nodes.bodyText: AbstractVividusDriverFactory -> AbstractVividusWebDriverFactory
DriverFactory -> WebDriverFactory
I recommend to make this method abstract and keep empty implementation in child classes

Given("I start mobile application located at $location")?
Why are capabilities needed?

Although we have an opportunity to set desired capabilities thorough meta at story level, by setting desired capabilities at step level we could use it in conjunction with lifecycle ET to run the same story several times on different devices
Imho this is more clear way to setup properties than at meta level

would not it better to name it
Given I start mobile application with capabilities: capabilities
?
I propose to do not make mobile_app as embedded vividus meta, let's allow users configure it

@@ -0,0 +1,111 @@
+= Plugin Mobile App
+
+== General Info
+
+The plugin provides functionality to test mobile application on real devides, simulators and emulators
+
+== Installation
+
+.build.gradle
+[source,gradle]
+----
+implementation(group: 'org.vividus', name: 'vividus-plugin-mobile-app', version: '<version>')
+----
+
+== Properties
+
+=== Required
+
+* `selenium.grid.device-name` - defines device name to run tests on
+* `selenium.grid.username` - defines remote grid username
+* `selenium.grid.password` - defines remote grid password
+* `selenium.grid.host` - defines remote grid host

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,111 @@
+= Plugin Mobile App
+
+== General Info
+
+The plugin provides functionality to test mobile application on real devides, simulators and emulators
+
+== Installation
+
+.build.gradle
+[source,gradle]
+----
+implementation(group: 'org.vividus', name: 'vividus-plugin-mobile-app', version: '<version>')
+----
+
+== Properties
+
+=== Required
+
+* `selenium.grid.device-name` - defines device name to run tests on
+* `selenium.grid.username` - defines remote grid username
+* `selenium.grid.password` - defines remote grid password
+* `selenium.grid.host` - defines remote grid host
+
+=== Optional
+
+* `selenium.grid.automation-name` - defines automation engine to use, e.g. `UIAutomator2` for `Android` platform and `XCUITest` for `iOS` platform
+* `selenium.grid.platform-name` - defines mobile OS to use, e.g. `Android` or `iOS`
+
+== Profiles
+
+=== Browserstack
+
+* The profile can be enabled by adding `browserstack/mobile_app` to `configuration.profiles` property
+* Browserstack specific properties must be prepended with `selenium.grid.capabilities.bstack\:options.` prefix, meaning given a property `projectName` with a value `My Project` the resulting property will be `selenium.grid.capabilities.bstack\:options.projectName=My Project`
+* Appium specific properties in browserstack must be prepended with `selenium.grid.capabilities.appium\:options.` prefix, meaning given a property `clearSystemFiles` with a value `true` the resulting property will be `selenium.grid.capabilities.appium\:options.clearSystemFiles=true`
+* Platform configurator can be found by the https://www.browserstack.com/automate/capabilities?tag=selenium-4 link

+implementation(group: 'org.vividus', name: 'vividus-plugin-mobile-app', version: '<version>')

nodes.bodyText: don't you mind to align it with getPropertyValuesTreeByPrefix?

Why it can't be part of mobile-app plugin?
If you starting web profile you will have RemoteDriverFactory if you starting the mobile app profile you will have an available factory for ios/android
Discussed privately
why it is necessary?

due to @nAmed and generic package that we scan converters are loaded regardless of the current profile, so when we start up mobile_app profile this converter is registered as a bean, but since it has dependencies on beans from web profile, the spring context startup fails
